sentence.Network_en: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一字一顿，听上去很生硬。

sentence.Network_en: He skimmed the pages quickly, then read them again more carefully.
sentence.Network_cn: 他先快速地浏览页面，然后再细细阅读。

sentence.Network_en: He moved carefully over what remained of partition walls.
sentence.Network_cn: 他小心翼翼地跨过残余的隔墙。

洪恩幼儿英语教师常用课堂用语200句 ... Please stop talking. 请不要讲话。 Listen carefully. 注意听。 Please be quiet. 请安静。.

entry.def: If you are careful, you give serious attention to what you are doing, in order to avoid harm, damage, or mistakes. If you are careful to do something, you make sure that you do it.

example.ex: Be very careful with this stuff, it can be dangerous if it isn't handled properly...
example.tran: 这东西一定要小心,稍不注意的话就会有危险。

entry.def: Careful work, thought, or examination is thorough and shows a concern for details.

example.ex: He has decided to prosecute her after careful consideration of all the relevant facts...
example.tran: 在认真考虑了所有相关事实后,他决定起诉她。

example.ex: What we now know about the disease was learned by careful study of diseased organs.
example.tran: 我们目前对该疾病的认识是通过对病变器官的仔细研究得来的。

entry.def: If you tell someone to be careful about doing something, you think that what they intend to do is probably wrong, and that they should think seriously before they do it.

example.ex: I think you should be careful about talking of the rebels as heroes...
example.tran: 我觉得你说话应该小心,不能把反叛分子当英雄。

example.ex: It is important, I think, for everyone to be careful about claiming victory.
example.tran: 我想,每个人宣布胜利时都应该慎重。

entry.def: If you are careful with something such as money or resources, you use or spend only what is necessary.

example.ex: You will have to make a special effort to train your child to be careful with her pocket-money...
example.tran: 你得格外注意培养孩子的节俭意识，零花钱要省着花。

example.ex: It would force industries to be more careful with natural resources.
example.tran: 这将迫使企业更加节约资源。

entry.tran: 越谨慎越好;再小心也不为过
entry.def: You can say 'You can't be too careful' as a way of advising someone to be careful, even when this seems unnecessary.

example.ex: You can't be too careful when a young child is near water.
example.tran: 孩子在水边时,还是越小心越好。

means.word_mean: 2. with caution or prudence or tact;

sentences.sentence: "they handled the incident with kid gloves"

auth_sentence.content: Carefully turn the rum babas over in the dish.
auth_sentence.res_content: Carefully turn the rum babas over in the dish.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Carefully turn the rum babas over in the dish.

auth_sentence.content: Carefully remove the potato skins and set it aside.
auth_sentence.res_content: Carefully remove the potato skins and set it aside.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Carefully remove the potato skins and set it aside.

auth_sentence.content: Carefully peel the peppers to remove all the skin.
auth_sentence.res_content: Carefully peel the peppers to remove all the skin.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Carefully peel the peppers to remove all the skin.

Sentence.sentence: By reading the textbooks carefully again.
The thefts are not the carefully planned burglaries(入室盗窃)that you see in movies.
Its conclusions are based on carefully collected data.
This experiment certainly does not definitely prove that girls start to reason before boys, but it provides a clue that scientists would like to study more carefully.
Americans are paying down debt, saving more, and spending more carefully.
As I was growing up, I remember being carefully taught that independence not interdependence was everything.

sentences.cn: 一个精心塑造的有教养的形象
